Package com.library.database.repositories

Class Repository<T extends DBEntity>

java.lang.Object
com.library.database.repositories.Repository<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of entity managed by the repository.
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AuthorRepository, BookFormRepository, BookInventoryRepository, BookRepository, EventNotificationRepository, ReaderRatingRepository, ReaderRepository, UserRepository
public abstract class Repository<T extends DBEntity> extends Object implements AutoCloseable
The Repository class provides a generic implementation for basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations using Hibernate as the underlying ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) framework. It serves as a base class for specific repositories handling entities of a particular type.

This class manages Hibernate sessions, transactions, and provides methods for common database operations, such as finding entities by ID, retrieving all entities, getting entities by ID, deleting entities, saving entities, and updating entities.

The class utilizes a ThreadLocal to manage the Hibernate Session instances for each thread, ensuring thread-safety in a multi-threaded environment.

Concrete subclasses must implement the following methods:

  • findById(Long): Find an entity by its ID.
  • findAll(): Retrieve all entities of the specified type.
  • getById(Long): Get an entity by its ID.

Additionally, the class supports methods for deleting, saving, and updating entities, with these operations encapsulated in a transaction.

The class also provides a method for executing an action inside a Hibernate transaction, ensuring proper handling of transactions.

Usage of this class requires the implementation of specific repositories for entities, extending this class.

Note: This class implements the AutoCloseable interface, allowing it to be used in try-with-resources constructs, ensuring proper resource management.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • findById

      public abstract Optional<T> findById(Long id) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Find and return an entity by its unique identifier (ID). This method utilizes the Hibernate session to perform the database operation. If the entity is not found, an empty Optional is returned.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the entity to find.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the found entity, or empty if the entity is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • findAll

      public abstract List<T> findAll() throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Retrieve and return a list of all entities of the specified type. This method uses Hibernates HQL (Hibernate Query Language) to execute a query to fetch all entities.
      Returns:
      A list containing all entities of the specified type.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • getById

      public abstract T getById(Long id) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Get and return an entity by its unique identifier (ID). This method is similar to findById(Long), but it returns the entity directly instead of wrapping it in an Optional. If the entity is not found, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the entity to get.
      Returns:
      The found entity, or null if the entity is not found.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • close

      public final void close() throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Close the Hibernate session associated with this repository. This method ensures that the session is closed and removes it from the ThreadLocal storage.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs while closing the Hibernate session.

    • delete

      public final boolean delete(T object) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Delete the specified entity from the database. This method encapsulates the deletion operation inside a Hibernate transaction.
      Parameters:
      object - The entity to be deleted.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • save

      public final boolean save(T object) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Save the specified entity to the database. This method encapsulates the save operation inside a Hibernate transaction.
      Parameters:
      object - The entity to be saved.
      Returns:
      True if the entity was saved successfully.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • update

      public final boolean update(T object) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Update the specified entity in the database. This method encapsulates the update operation inside a Hibernate transaction.
      Parameters:
      object - The entity to be updated.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.

    • deleteAll

      public final void deleteAll(Collection<T> entities) throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
      Delete multiple entities from the database. This method encapsulates the deletion operation inside a Hibernate transaction.
      Parameters:
      entities - The collection of books to be deleted.
      Throws:
      org.hibernate.HibernateException - If an error occurs during the Hibernate operation.
